thread.title: Abu Sayyaf behead German hostage Jurgen Kantner in Philippines with ISIS-style video after ransom demands aren't met
thread.title_full: Abu Sayyaf behead German hostage Jurgen Kantner in Philippines with ISIS-style video after ransom demands aren't met

title: Abu Sayyaf behead German hostage Jurgen Kantner in Philippines with ISIS-style video after ransom demands aren't met
text:
Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments AN ISIS-affiliated group have “beheaded a German hostage” in the Philippines after their ransom demands were not met. 
Jurgen Kantner, a German Sailor, was abducted from his yacht in the Philippines on November 6. 
The Islamic terror group demanded a ransom of 30 million pesos (£485,264) for his release. 
Jurgen was seen asking the German embassy for help in a video released on February 14. 
The group said they would kill the hostage if their demands were not met by Sunday at 9am. 
The 70-year-old’s wife Sabine Merz was killed by the militants who abducted her husband. 
Both Jurgen and Sabine were kidnapped by Somali pirates and held hostage for 58 days in the Gulf of Aden in 2008. 
Sabine was found naked and investigators say she was shot. 
For the latest news on this story keep checking back at Sun Online, where we will bring you live updates as soon as they happen, before anyone else. 

Like us on Facebook at www.facebook.com/thesun , and follow us from our main Twitter account at @TheSun , where we will bring you this story and all the rest of the top news and exclusives of the day.
